distributional 0.3.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.006677559 10.175113585
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.1232441 0.9293591
skewness(dist)
#> [1]  0.6038447 -0.2434758
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -0.347205024  0.026934183 -0.848571680  0.705673701  0.868767546
#>  [6] -0.704461958  0.217081103  0.929198779 -0.004179547  0.361469528
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.679200  9.082432 11.161359  8.514281  9.829708 11.161359 10.268918
#>  [8] 10.119809  9.185086 11.056537
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2286397 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.01052842  9.89886397
variance(dist)
#>             [,1]        [,2]
#> [1,]  1.06294934 -0.00690715
#> [2,] -0.00690715  0.74620730
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.01844727
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -1.14821818  9.778145
#>  [2,] -0.55365510  8.844710
#>  [3,]  1.50331241 11.018153
#>  [4,] -0.03526753 11.201607
#>  [5,] -1.25970224  8.965907
#>  [6,]  2.89936099  9.875643
#>  [7,] -3.32671703 10.247202
#>  [8,] -0.39211390  9.573051
#>  [9,]  1.47899948 11.951037
#> [10,] -1.68844392 10.218103
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.1930805 0.0000000
